comments:
There are a few issues we have seen when trying to import utility jars into an EAR. When importing a jar as a link it does not import. Using an existing EAR I am doing the following:

Import->J2EE Utility Jar->Create Linked Utility Jars in an existing EAR...

However nothing happens. No linked utility jar shows up in the EAR, and there are no errors. The .log is clean as well.

There may or may not be a second issue. I found the above problem when I was trying to repro another issue. The user import was working (may have been a different level of wtp) but when they tried to publish the EAR with the linked jar the publish would fail with the following stack:

ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.server.core 4 0 2006-11-06 14:09:01.250
!MESSAGE Could not publish to the server.
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Path must include project and resource name: /cargo-0.5.jar
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.newResource(Workspace.java:1571)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.getFile(Container.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.resources.VirtualArchiveComponent.getWorkspaceRelativePath(VirtualArchiveComponent.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.wst.web.internal.deployables.ComponentDeployable.addUtilMembers(ComponentDeployable.java:350)
	at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.deployables.J2EEFlexProjDeployable.members(J2EEFlexProjDeployable.java:193)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ModulePublishInfo.fill(ModulePublishInfo.java:316)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerPublishInfo.fill(ServerPublishInfo.java:267)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server$5.visit(Server.java:868)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.visitModule(Server.java:2355)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.visit(Server.java:2339)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.doPublish(Server.java:865)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.publish(Server.java:850)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.PublishServerJob.run(PublishServerJob.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
This is not a base WTP problem.

As discussed externally this issue does seem to be a base wtp issue as the problem is the linked jar does not show up anywhere in the project explorer or the workspace in 1.5.2. I would like to keep this open until we are sure it is resolved as I am still seeing this behaviour.
Untargetting this defect.   Only critical issues are being reviewed for 1.5.3.

traces.message: Path must include project and resource name: /cargo-0.5.jar
